title: Open Know-How manifest schema for Helpful Engineering

date-created.description: Indicates the date the manifest was originally created

date-updated.description: Indicates the date the manifest was last edited

manifest-author.description: States the person who has created and is responsible for the content in the manifest

title.description: A title to identify the thing

intended-use.description: Informs the maker for what purpose the designer intends the thing to be used. In particular, make reference to the context and type of users

keywords.description: Provides a small number of terms that can be used to help identify

project-link.description: Where the thing or associated project has a web presence that is separate from the documentation (e.g. a marketing page), links to the web resource
project-link.$comment: At least one of the project-link or documentation-home fields is required

health-safety-notice.description: Highlight health and safety risks and/or necessary precautions that the maker should be aware of as part of the decision to make the thing

contact.description: Provides a point of contact for people who wish to discuss the thing

contributors.description: Credits the contributors to the know-how

image.description: Provides a graphical representation of the thing

version.description: Defines the version of the thing that is represented by this manifest

development-stage.description: Indicates the maturity of the design and documentation development

made.description: Indicates whether the thing has been made and verifies that it is makeable

made-independently.description: Indicates whether the thing has been made using the documentation by someone who was not a contributor to the design or documentation and, therefore, verifies that the documentation is sufficient to make the thing

standard-title.description: Title of the standard used in developing the design or documentation

certifier.description: Individual or organisation granting the certification. Use "Self" for self-certification

link.description: Link to evidence of certification (e.g. certificate)

certification.description: If certification has been granted confirming compliance with the standard

derivative-of.description: Where the thing is a derivative of a different thing (e.g. the documentation has been forked), links to the original thing

variant-of.description: Where the thing is a variant, links to the original

sub.description: Where the design uses sub-components, sub-assemblies etc that are also available as open know-how, links to the documentation

license.description: States the licenses under which the thing is made available
license.$comment: At least one license is required.

licensor.description: States who is licensing the thing.

documentation-home.description: Provides a URL entry point to the documentation
documentation-home.$comment: At least one of the project-link or documentation-home fields is required

archive-download.description: Links to a location from which the full documentation can be downloaded as an archive (e.g. zip file)

bom.description: Links to the bill of materials

tool-list.description: Links to a list of tools required to make the thing

making-instructions.description: Links to the making instructions, e.g. assembly instructions

manufacturing-files.description: Links to the manufacturing files, such as 3D printing files

tool-settings.description: Links to settings for tools and machines

operating-instructions.description: Links to instructions for operating the thing

maintenance-instructions.description: Links to instructions for operating the thing

disposal-instructions.description: Links to instructions for disposing the thing at the end of its life

software.description: Links to source code repository or software executables used by the thing

manifest-language.description: States the language in which the manifest has been produced

documentation_language.description: States the language in which the documentation has been produced

manifest-is-translation.description: Where this manifest is a translation of another, links to the original

documentation-is-translation.description: Where this manifest references documentation that is translated, links to the original

product-atom.description: describes the output of this OKH as an atom

bom-atoms.description: describes the bill of materials to make this OKH as a an array of atoms

tool-list-atoms.description: describes the tools needed to make this OKH as a an array of atoms

bom-output-atoms.description: describes additional outputs of this OKH besides the product-atom

Contact.$comment: email address or at least one social media user handle is required

Language.description: ISO 639 language code. Use the Alpha-2 code where available. Optionally, the ISO 3166 country code may be included.
